ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were making elongated mouthfuls. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.3.1_0: “‘I will make rounded mouthfuls,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes a long mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.13_0: if it is a special curry;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.16_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.17_0: The tenth training rule is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.18_0: The fourth sub-chapter on respectfully is finished.
